intro: Psychotria flexuosa, commonly known as the "Coca plant," is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to South America. It is a shrub that typically grows in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and small, white or greenish flowers. It produces small, red berries that contain the alkaloid cocaine. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has significant historical and contemporary importance in both traditional and modern contexts.
